example: A prominent archaeologist led the team that discovered the ancient city.
The site was occupied by a civilization over 2,000 years ago.
Scientists document every artifact found during the excavation process.
The researcher dedicated her lifetime to studying ancient agricultural practices.
The project received substantial funding to excavate the remote site.
Ancient cave paintings depict people cultivating wheat and other crops.
Special techniques are used to preserve fragile artifacts like pollen samples.
Satellite technology helps locate ancient sites that are otherwise inaccessible.
Experts can distinguish between different types of wheat based on their pollen composition.
Analyzing the composition of soil reveals what crops were cultivated there.
The team faced resistance when trying to access the undisturbed site.
Archaeologists avoid direct contact with artifacts to prevent damage.
A simplification of the findings helps the public understand the research better.
Diagrams illustrate how ancient people conducted electricity for their rituals.
The profile of the hill revealed an ancient settlement beneath the surface.
The discovery of a new artifact was a major breakthrough for the team.
Scientists retrieve pollen samples to study ancient plant life.
The excavation revealed a well-preserved temple from a lost civilization.
Approximately 500 artifacts were found during the summer survey.
Pollen grains in the soil indicate which plants were cultivated in the area.
Ancient texts document the cultivation of wheat as a staple crop.
The civilization began to cultivate wheat around 5,000 years ago.
Each artifact is carefully cleaned and documented after being excavated.
Researchers hypothesize that the site was used for religious ceremonies.
The remote location of the site kept it undisturbed for centuries.
The undisturbed tomb contained many well-preserved artifacts.
The team made a phenomenal discovery of ancient electric current conductors.
A preliminary survey helped locate promising areas for excavation.
Only authorized personnel have access to the secure artifact storage area.
They plan to excavate the site to find more evidence of ancient life.
The cave was inaccessible until the team built a special pathway.
The unstable ground made the site too insecure for excavation.
Substantial evidence supports the hypothesis about ancient wheat cultivation.
The collapse of the ancient building preserved many artifacts inside.
The promising site is expected to yield many important discoveries.

chinese: 心理图像 / 心中画面
example: Descriptions of the site help create a mental picture of ancient life.
Certain stones were used to conduct electricity in ancient rituals.
Traces of ancient electric current were found in the ritual site.
The report should not leave out any details about the artifact's composition.
Preserving the artifacts is the top priority for the archaeological team.
